name: Meatloaf Patties
author: courtneynjones
ingredients: 1 slice soft bread, blended into crumbs
2 ¼ tablespoons brown sugar, or to taste
directions: Mix egg, bread crumbs, salt, and black pepper together in a large bowl
Break ground beef into small pieces and add to the bowl; mix well with your hands until beef is evenly moistened
Shape the beef mixture into four patties
Heat a skillet over medium heat
Cook patties in hot skillet until completely browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side; remove to a platter and drain grease from skillet
Stir tomato sauce, green onions, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and yellow mustard together in the skillet
Gently lie the patties into the sauce; bring liquid to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the patties are very firm, hot, and grey in the center, about 10 minutes more
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
